meanings.definition: To give someone the right to do or have something.
meanings.sent1: By entitling her to the prize, he made her very happy.
meanings.sent2: The certificate entitling him to a free meal was in his wallet.
meanings.sent3: Entitling him to stay up late was a mistake, as he was too tired the next day.
meanings.sent4: The key entitling access to the treasure chest was hidden under the rock.
meanings.sent5: The golden ticket entitling entry to the exclusive event was highly sought after.

meanings.definition: To give a title to something.
meanings.sent1: She was entitling her artwork with creative and meaningful names.
meanings.sent2: The author was entitling his new book with a catchy phrase.
meanings.sent3: Entitling the painting 'Sunset Serenity' added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: The artist was entitling his masterpiece 'Eternal Beauty'.
meanings.sent5: The musician was entitling his latest album 'Melodies of the Heart'.

meanings.definition: To qualify someone for a particular benefit or privilege.
meanings.sent1: His hard work entitling him to a promotion was finally recognized.
meanings.sent2: The membership card entitling discounts was a great perk.
meanings.sent3: Entitling early registration to loyal customers was a smart move by the company.
meanings.sent4: The special pass entitling VIP treatment made her feel like a star.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship entitling free tuition was a dream come true for the student.
